Invocation

Delivered by: Pandit Tillack Seerattan, Shri Devi Mandir, 92-30 173rd Street, Jamaica, N.Y. 11433.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Miller.

The Invocation was delivered by: Pandit Tillack Seerattan, Shri Devi Mandir, 92-30 173rd Street, Jamaica, N.Y. 11433.

Council Member Miller moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 15, 2015 be adopted as printed by Council Member Levine.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Levine moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 15, 2015 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Designating special commercial abatement areas under the New York City Industrial and Commercial Abatement program (ICAP) pursuant to paragraph c of subdivision 2 of RPTL section 489-gggggg and paragraph 3 of subdivision b of section 11-274 of the administrative code.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Designating special commercial abatement areas under the NYC Industrial and Commercial Abatement Program (ICAP).

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Janet Alvarez to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment to the New York City Tax Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 153 of the New York City Charter
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Janet Alvarez, New York City Tax Commission

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Chin:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 643 Broadway, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board No. 2, Application No. 20165089 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 643 Broadway, Manhattan (20165089 TCM)

Report of the Committee on Civil Service and Labor

A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of an office of labor standards, and to repeal subdivision (i) of section 20-a of such charter and section 20-925 of such code, relating to the designation of an agency to enforce the Earned Sick Time Act
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to realigning contribution limits to transition and inauguration entities with contribution limits to campaigns
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Realigning contribution limits to transition and inauguration entities with contribution limits to campaigns.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of an M/WBE advisory board
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Establishment of an M/WBE advisory board.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending the rate of the additional tax on the occupancy of hotel rooms
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Extending the rate of the additional tax on the occupancy of hotel rooms.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an advisory board on crossing guard deployment.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: An advisory board on crossing guard deployment.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a new parking permit for expectant mothers experiencing a difficult or complicated pregnancy
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Creating a new parking permit for expectant mothers experiencing a difficult or complicated pregnancy.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Requiring air quality monitoring near marine transfer stations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to eliminating public matching funds for contributions bundled by people doing business with the city
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Eliminating public matching funds for contributions bundled by people doing business with the city.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Early public funds payments in local elections

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the minimum amount of money raised to participate in the first official campaign finance board debate for local offices
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Increasing the minimum amount of money raised to participate in the first official campaign finance board debate for local offices.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to allowing for flexibility with respect to the voter guide
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Allowing for flexibility with respect to the voter guide.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting contributions from non-registered political committees to candidates who are not participating in the city’s public matching program
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting contributions from non-registered political committees to candidates who are not participating in the city’s public matching program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the limitation on parking of mobile homes and trailers on residential streets
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Limitation on parking of mobile homes and trailers on residential streets.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on crossing guard deployment.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Reporting on crossing guard deployment.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to changing the date of an annual report related to sexually exploited children.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Changing the date of an annual report related to sexually exploited children.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the use of certain credit information in rental housing applications
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Use of certain credit information in rental housing applications.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to electronic mail for trees of significant interest
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Electronic mail for trees of significant interest.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of unpaid military family leave
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Provision of unpaid military family leave.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an unused muni-meter time mobile application.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Unused muni-meter time mobile application.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report arrests resulting from Local Law 29 of 2014.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the police department to report arrests resulting from Local Law 29 of 2014.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to conduct a comprehensive study of unused and underutilized railroad rights of way in New York City for the purpose of evaluating the feasibility of increased passenger service along such corridors.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA to conduct a comprehensive study of unused and underutilized railroad rights of way in NYC for the purpose of evaluating the feasibility of increased passenger service along such corridors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report on seized property data on an annual basis and removing an existing requirement concerning reporting on disposition of certain unclaimed property
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the PD to report on seized property data on an annual basis and removing an existing requirement concerning reporting on disposition of certain unclaimed property.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a task force on information security for city agencies.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Creation of a task force on information security for city agencies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring disclosure of entities that own entities that do business with the city
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Requiring disclosure of entities that own entities that do business with the city.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the conflicts of interest board to maintain records of compliance with the conflicts of interest law for participants in the city’s public matching program
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Requiring the conflicts of interest board to maintain records of compliance with the conflicts of interest law for participants in the city’s public matching program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Education Department and the New York City Department of Education to use only meat, poultry, and produce that has been certified as organic by the United States Department of Agriculture.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: NYS Education Dept and the NYC Dept of Education to use only meat, poultry, and produce that has been certified as organic by the US Dept of Agriculture.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to pedestrian control signals
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Pedestrian control signals.

Items.Title: Application No. 20165089 TCM pursuant to Section 20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of 643 Broadway Holdings LLC, for a revocable consent to establish, maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 643 Broadway, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 2, Council District 1. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 20-226 of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Zoning, BLEECKER KITCHEN & CO. - 643 Broadway, Manhattan (20165089 TCM)

Items.Title: Application No. C 150399 PPK submitted by the New York City Department of Citywide Administrative Services, pursuant to Section 197-c of the New York City Charter, for the disposition of city-owned property located at 1 Clinton Street (aka 280 Cadman Plaza West), Block 239, Lot 16, Borough of Brooklyn, Community District 2, Council District 33. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to 197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called up by a vote of the council pursuant to 197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Planning, 1 Clinton Street, Brooklyn (C 150399 PPK)

Items.Title: Application No. C 150400 PQK submitted by the New York City Department of Citywide Administrative Services and the New York City Economic Development Corporation, pursuant to Section 197-c of the New York City Charter, for the acquisition of a condominium unit for use as a Brooklyn Public Library branch library, located at 1 Clinton Street (aka 280 Cadman Plaza West), Block 239, Lot 16, Borough of Brooklyn, Community District 2, Council District 33. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to 197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called up by a vote of the council pursuant to 197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Planning, 1 Clinton Street, Brooklyn (C 150400 PQK)

Items.Title: Application No. 20165204 HAX submitted by the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development pursuant to Section 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law for a real property tax exemption for 19 multiple dwellings known as Bronx Shepherds, Borough of the Bronx, Community Boards 2, 3, 5, and 9, Council Districts 14, 15, 16, 17 and 18.

Items.Title:
By Council Member Levin:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application Nos. C 150399 PPK and C 150400 PQK, a disposition of city-owned property and a related acquisition, shall be subject to Council Review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Planning, 1 Clinton Street (aka 280 Cadman Plaza West), Brooklyn (C 150399 PPK and C 150400 PQK)

Items.MinutesNote: The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Public Advocate (Ms. James) adjourned to meet again on Tuesday, November 24, 2015.



MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk

Clerk of the Council
